Package org.berthold.beamCalc

Class Load

java.lang.Object
org.berthold.beamCalc.Load
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Load>
public class Load
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Load>
Load. Defines a single or a line load in [N] acting on a Beam Sign:

Vertical loads: Force acting downwards (-) Load acting upwards (+). Horizontal force acts to the left (+), force acts to the right (-)

Angle in degrees:

Right side angles range from 0 to 180 deg, clockwise. Left side angles range from 0 to -179 deg, counterclokwise.

Samples

+90 deg. load acting to left, horizontally
+45 deg. load acting diagonally from upper right to bottom left
+135 deg. same as +45 but acting from lower right to upper left

A negative load at an angle of 180 deg. is the same as a positive load acting at 0 deg.

Author:
Berthold ToDo: There is no constructor included yet, which allows to add a single load. If one want's to do so, the length of the line load and the ending force have to be passed as 0. The starting force is the magnitute of the single load: => Add constructor for single load. Add field singleForce_N..... The formula for calculating the center of gravity delivers exact results only for uniformingly distributed line loads, not for uniformingly changing line loads!

      This constructor allows to add constant line loads by passing the load magnitude and the length of the load acting.
      Parameters:
      nameOfLoad - Any name allowed (F1, q1 etc..).
      force_N - The force acting (-) downwards. (+) upwards.
      distanceFromLeftEndOfBeam_m - Position of force acting.
      angleOfLoad_degrees - Angle.
      lengthOfLineLoad_m - Length, if line load.
      includeThisLoadIntoCaclulation - Use where aplicable....
      thisLoadHasAnError - Use where aplicable....

  • Method Details

    • getForce_N

      public double getForce_N()
      Returns:
      Either the force of the single load acting or, if this load is a constant line load, the force/ m (qn)

    • getResultantForce_N

      public double getResultantForce_N()
      For line loads or uniformly changing line loads:
      Returns:
      The resultant force acting at the enter of gravity.

    • getForceStart_N

      public double getForceStart_N()
      For uniformly changing line loads:
      Returns:
      Force at the start.

    • getForceEnd_N

      public double getForceEnd_N()
      For uniformly changing line loads.
      Returns:
      Force at the end.

    • getCenterOfGravity_m

      public double getCenterOfGravity_m()
      Returns:
      Center of gravity relative to the start of this line load. If the length of line load and the magnitutes of the forces at the end/ start of the line load is 0, this load is handled like any single load and it's position relative to the left end of the beam is returned.
